paragraphs: A 2-year experienced **Backend Developer** focused on continuous learning, growth, and demonstrating strong leadership capabilities.
Beyond merely writing code, I utilize principles of **Object-Oriented Design** to architect and build flexible, scalable systems with future maintainability and extensibility in mind.

**I thrive in highly concurrent and non-blocking development environments.** To establish an efficient development pipeline, I successfully spearheaded the adoption of a structured development process, enhancing system stability and automating resource-intensive deployment tasks, thereby **leading** the improvement of the in-house development culture.

**Driven by the belief that 'if you want to go fast, go alone; if you want to go far, go together,'** I champion the continuous growth of the entire team. I focus on achieving sustainable code through comprehensive testing, clear design documentation, and thorough code reviews, ensuring that the entire team can understand and contribute. I believe this collaborative approach is the most effective way to enhance both team productivity and service quality.

Leveraging a **quick learning ability in new domains**, I have expanded my experience beyond backend development to include frontend and AI/ML fields. I have demonstrated adaptability by training CNN models and optimizing model serving APIs to achieve a **180% increase in TPS**.

experiences.name: System Monitoring Agent Development
background: In an environment where numerous processes on 16 distributed servers across 4 data centers operate organically, faults were often recognized only through 'customer inquiries,' leading to excessive time spent on root cause analysis.
There was a critical need to optimize the time spent monitoring 'why,' 'how,' and 'for how long' a problem persisted.
content: **Fault Management:** Real-time detection of abnormal events, including service interruption, hardware failure, network disconnection, and application errors.
**Failover:** Developed a system for reloading core processes upon error or termination to ensure continuity.
**Critical Property Management:** Developed an agent to monitor and detect mismatches in mission-critical properties and configuration files.
result: Achieved **99.9% uptime** for servers handling **6000+ tps** from 300,000 users.
Reduced service interruption and incident alarm failures to **less than 5%** (critical network alarms still represent a known area for improvement).

experiences.name: Internal Development Process Automation
background: Recurring issues such as frequent deployment failures and errors, slow development cycles, repetitive manual deployment tasks, technical debt, and workflow bottlenecks.
content: Researched team-level development methodologies within the company.
Analyzed bottlenecks in the existing manual deployment process and collected improvement requirements through interviews with fellow developers.
Designed and implemented a CI/CD pipeline architecture using GitLab Native (GitLab Runner, GitLab Image Registry, k8s) based on the company's existing GitLab environment.
result: Deployment time reduced by **30%**, and a periodic deployment environment was successfully established.
Continuously received positive feedback from colleagues regarding increased work efficiency.

experiences.name: Next-Generation Geospatial Data Management Web Application Development
background: Need for real-time access for multiple users in the existing client-server (CS) geospatial data editing tool.
Increased necessity for organic, real-time interaction events (CRUD, Merge, Split, etc.) between geospatial features via a web-based migration.
content: Designed and developed data models and APIs for geospatial feature editing and real-time collaboration.
Implemented a **Lock Mechanism** to resolve data inconsistency issues during real-time collaboration.
Developed a user-interactive map UI using **React.js** to manage feature states and build user-interactive pages.

other-experiences.name: LensPay Development
content: Service development, deployment, and maintenance.
[Information Site](http://introduce.lenspay.site)

content: Improved test code for the Apache Gravitino CLI module.

content: Data labeling and preparation.
CNN model training and research.
Optimized the API serving server to achieve a **180% increase in TPS** compared to the baseline model.
[Project GitHub](https://github.com/su8y/yolov8-fire-smoke-detection)

content: Operated online/offline study groups to expose members to diverse algorithm problems and share problem-solving perspectives.
Led 4 weeks of online studies, resulting in a total of 500+ problem completions and reviews.
[Project GitHub](https://github.com/su8y/yolov8-fire-smoke-detection)

skills.name: Java & Spring
skills.description: I have a deep understanding of Object-Oriented Design principles, implementing flexible and scalable architectures, and building robust, testable systems based on **TDD** (Test-Driven Development).

skills.name: Typescript & React.js
skills.description: Built user interfaces (UI) for GIS map applications, demonstrating proficiency in component-based development and state management to construct dynamic UIs.

skills.name: C/C++
description: Contributed to the development of a system monitoring agent for a system valued over 10 billion KRW (approx. 7.3 million USD), focusing on stable logic implementation.
Specifically, provided support for careful design in resource-constrained environments and built a **Failover** mechanism to ensure service continuity during failures.

skills.name: Python & Pytorch
description: Capable of rapid prototyping for problem-solving.

Experienced in research and optimization of CNN-based forest fire monitoring models, utilizing these skills for the development, training, and evaluation of machine learning models, and independently driving **PoC** (Proof of Concept) development for ML model serving.

skills.name: PostgresSql
skills.description: Deeply understand the core principles of relational databases, utilizing this knowledge for effective data modeling and efficient query writing.

skills.name: Docker & Kubernetes
skills.description: As part of the [Journey to End Inefficiency] project, I utilize these technologies, integrated with a CI/CD pipeline, to automate building, testing, and deployment, thereby improving development productivity and contributing to quality enhancement through effective test environment setup.
